segments.script:
If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone.

Hey there, Appalachia! It's Julie here on Radio Appalachia. I heard something kinda interesting recently, and I thought I'd share with y'all. Apparently, up in the Cranberry Glades, some folks have seen what they call a "Scorched Ghost Town." 

Now, I don't know if that's just another wild rumor or not, but it got me thinking. Maybe there are still some old settlements out there, hidden away from the rest of us. You know, like little pockets of survivors who managed to hang on after everything went to hell.

I mean, can you imagine stumbling upon a whole town of people living in secret? It'd be like finding a piece of the old world again! Of course, it's probably just some folks spinning tall tales around a campfire... but hey, wouldn't it be something if it was true?

Anyway, that's my little morsel of wasteland gossip for today. Stay safe out there, and keep those ears open! Maybe you'll uncover your own hidden story someday. Until next time, this is Julie signing off from Appalachia Radio - the voice in the wilderness, keeping hope alive one song at a time.
